story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Back Forty Highlander land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Back Forty Highlander? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Back Forty Highlander scored 47 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Back Forty Highlander?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Back Forty Highlander. Mississippi Station, Ontario. 62 mi. Rolling farmland and forest roads with moderate elevation and mixed surface conditions.
beats.text_on_screen: Back Forty Highlander | Mississippi Station, Ontario | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Value. 4 out of 5. Strong value proposition. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Your wallet will survive this one. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. Riders finish at Back Forty Artisan Cheese Farm's "picturesque location" on the Mississippi River shore with "calming distant sound of waterfalls. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. The venue earns praise for its "gorgeous venue and delicious post-ride meals" at the artisan cheese farm. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. The race starts at Back Forty Artisan Cheese Farm on 1406 Gulley Road, but rider navigation issues plagued the 2025 event. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Single lane treed gravel roads through challenging sections at Ranger Camp, North Shore, and Clarendon test bike handling skills. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Rolling terrain. Nothing that'll break you. Rolling hills through North Frontenac and Lanark Highlands create steady climbing rather than explosive ascents.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Light adventure. Nothing wild. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Not exactly stacked.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: What Back Forty Highlander does well.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: Affordable registration and low travel costs for regional riders
Strong community atmosphere and volunteer support
Accessible course for various skill levels
No crowds or registration lottery stress

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.narration: What they don't put on the website.
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: Basic amenities and limited aid stations
Rural location requires travel from major cities
No significant prize purse or prestige

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Ottawa International Airport - ~1 hour drive
Lodging: Limited lodging in Mississippi Station. Stay in Ottawa or nearby towns. Book early if staying locally. Camping may be available.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Regional Gem. If you're in the region and want an affordable, well-organized gravel race with good vibes. yes. If you're traveling from far away or seeking competitive depth and prestige. probably not worth the trip. This is a local favorite for good reason, but it's not trying to be more than it is.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Back Forty Highlander isn't quite right for you. For bigger Ontario events: try Gravel Growler. For similar grassroots vibes in other regions: Barry-Roubaix, Almanzo, or Dirty Kanza.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Back Forty Highlander? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Back Forty Highlander' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
